data.title: Tree: Cancelling the file creation by scrolling causes the Explorer shows not correctly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder such as "vscode-master"
2. expand folder "build" then "monaco"
3. click the "New File" button, then scroll to cancel the file creation
4. do step 3 again (sometimes not needed)
5. collapse and expand "monaco" for several times, the Explorer shows not correctly

When the Explorer shows not correctly, scrolling makes it even worse..
And when something like this happens, we have to reopen VSCode to make it normal.

data.title: Security - JavaScript scripts in Markdown files are executed when files are previewed
data.body:
In versions prior to v1.10.2, JavaScript scripts contained in script tags inside markdown files are executed when previewing the markdown file using <kbd>Cmd+Shift+P</kbd> > `Markdown: Open Preview` or `Markdown: Open Preview to the Side`.

If users preview markdown files they have not closely inspected, they are expose to any potential security risk posed by the scripts contained within the markdown file.

With version v.1.10.2, scripts are no longer executed by default. Users are informed if a markdown file contains scripts, and can decided if the preview should execute the scripts.

data.title: Unicode shade characters rendered too tall - overlapping lines

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-javascript-snippet-pack|akamud|0.1.5|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.11.0|
|vscode-twig-pack|bajdzis|1.0.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.1|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.11|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|
|nunjucks|ronnidc|0.2.3|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy and paste the following text into vscode:
```
░
 ▒
  ▓
  
▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒
▒ A BOX! ▒
▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒
```
This is how it looks to me:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/274012/23730249/17a6c202-042c-11e7-8b6e-f8529bd41d83.png)

I would expect something like this (from Notepad++):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/274012/23730277/39505ae4-042c-11e7-85a2-d21f9ab39378.png)

This is my settings.json file:
```
{
    "window.zoomLevel": 0,
    "editor.tabSize": 2,
    "editor.useTabStops": false,
    "git.enabled": false,
    "workbench.iconTheme": "vscode-icons"
}
```

Here's a link to information on one of the shade characters: http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2591/index.htm

The only work around I've found is changing the font to 'Courier New' which I can't stand or setting "editor.lineHeight": 26 which looks pretty silly.

P.S. Loving vscode!

data.title: make finding all references more user-friendly
data.body:
_From @bruceauyeung on March 7, 2017 8:45_

`Finding all references` will popup a window to show all references, i think it's a little hard to use, i am not blaming vscode-go, maybe it's vscode's limitation because vscode don't provide a view similar with output, problem etc.
1. once user close the popped-up window, referencing results is lost. user have to find all references again if they just closed the window by accident. most other IDEs such as Eclipse, Gogland, they display references in a view , the referencing results will not be lost until user do finding all references again.
2. user may close the window by accident very easily.  currently the window have a close button, a window bar, if user single-click the left part of menu bar or drag the window  on left part of menu bar( mouse pointer becomes to a finger when hovering on it, this indicates user can do something ), window will be closed.

so i suggest:

1, if it's possible, display references in a view similar with problem etc, not in a popup window. if not, 
2, do not close window when left part of menu bar is clicked or dragged, only close window when close button is close or content part of window is double-clicked.

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-go#845_

data.title: Add a shell selection prompt on Windows
data.body:
To avoid issues users have been having with the new default PS and also enable easier selection of their preferred terminal I'm proposing that on Windows^ only we show a quick pick to select a terminal shell the first time they open the terminal:

1. ctrl+`
2. quick pick: Select shell (cmd, PS\*, WSL bash\*, Git bash\*)
3. User selects a shell and `terminal.integrated.shell.windows` is written to `settings.json`

Technically this would work by defaulting `terminal.integrated.shell.windows` to `null` on Windows and always show the quick pick when the value is null. That means pressing `ESC` to dismiss the quick pick will not launch a terminal.

There is the concern of more choice will detract from the lightweight feeling of the product but I believe it's worth the trade off in this case. It should be a very easy decision for the user, we can track feedback from Insiders.

*\* If present*
*^ The reason it's Windows only is because on Mac and Linux `$SHELL` will contain the correct shell in the vast majority of cases so no need to bug the user.*

/cc @daviwil @kieferrm

data.title: API feature request to NOT modify the file after TextEditorEdit#setEndOfLine is called
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using the API, call [`TextEditorEdit#setEndOfLine`](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#_a-nametexteditoreditaspan-classcodeitem-id339texteditoreditspan)
2. Notice that the file is now marked dirty.

This would be OK for most purposes, but for the purpose of [`editorconfig-vscode`](https://github.com/editorconfig/editorconfig-vscode), we don't wish to modify the file (marking it dirty) on open.

This feature request is requesting an option I can send along, like so:

```ts
setEndOfLine(eol, { modify: false });
```
This would be backwards compatible.

Related issues:
 - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9494
 - https://github.com/editorconfig/editorconfig-vscode/issues/57 and the host of duplicates filed (see the bottom of the page).

data.title: --uninstall-extension doesn't seem to work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.2|
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. code --uninstall-extension ms-vscode.cpptools

Description:
We have a user who is asking for scriptability with updating extensions.  I didn't see a --update-extension switch for vs code, so I was trying out --uninstall-extension to see if they could script an update by uninstalling and reinstalling the extension.  This is what code prints out when I attempt to uninstall via the cmd line:
```
Uninstalling ms-vscode.cpptools...
{ [Canceled: Canceled] name: 'Canceled', message: 'Canceled' }
```
see: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/306

data.title: Feature Request: Keybind/Enable by default : Collapse All for find results
data.body:
Hi, I didn't see a setting or keybind for Collapsing all in search results so that only filenames are displayed. Would like to request this feature as a default as well as keybindable.

Thanks.

data.title: Raspberry issue during npm run watch (gulp watch --max_old_space_size=4096)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. git fetch origin
2. cd vscode
3. sudo ./scripts/npm.sh install
4. sudo npm run watch 


Please find below the output in the console and the content of npm-debug.log
Any help and advises are welcome
Best regards, Philippe

PS : similar behavior if step 3 above is

data.title: TypeScript should use double quotes for string in import snippet.
data.body: From style guide: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/Coding-guidelines #22231

data.title: Selected section will be lost in replace text

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version 1.10.2 (1.10.2) (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T13:54:01.558Z)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3 (16D32)
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit js file. Select some lines and click "Cmd+F" to popup search&replace dialog 
2.In the first input enter some text that I want to replace. This text also appears out of the section that I selected in the above step.
3.Then I click the "Find in the selection" button in order to replace only the text in my selection part. Now the selection is lost. Only one line that which is before my selection part but also has the searched text will be highlighted. My selection before showing the search dialog is lost. 

The expected behavior is that the my selection is still there and I can continue to replace.

data.title: VSCode on OSX crashes with exception from SQRLDirectoryManager.m after 30 seconds

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10, I think the current is 1.10.2 on the download page
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

VSCode crashes randomly after 30 seconds. It´s unusable right now. Exception is thrown with error message (full log at the end of the issue description):

```
*** Assertion failure in +[SQRLDirectoryManager currentApplicationManager], /Users/joshaber/Documents/Development/GitHub/Squirrel.Mac/Squirrel/SQRLDirectoryManager.m:30
2017-03-08 21:56:21.169 code[13965:62957] An uncaught exception was raised
2017-03-08 21:56:21.169 code[13965:62957] Could not automatically determine the current application's identifier
```



Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download vscode for osx from website
2. Create symlink in terminal
```
sudo ln -s "/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/MacOS/Electron" /usr/local/bin/code
```
3. Start vscode via symlink in terminal `code ~/.zhsrc`
4. Crashes randomly after some time


data.title: Markdown preview occupies a small part of the editor window
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 (but also occurred in versions 1.9-1.10.1)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select ```Open Preview``` on a Markdown file.
2. Preview of markdown file occupies a small frame of the editor window. This happens with a full or split editor window.  This is what it looks like:
![screenshot from 2017-03-08 15-56-30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/942174/23723913/ebeb7fd0-0418-11e7-92bc-ef6fc32a84a7.png)

data.title: JSDoc completer not adding params to functions that are assigned to object keys
data.body: ### Expected behavior The params are inferred from the function signature, like this: ### Actual behavior If the assigned variable is an object key, no params are inferred: This particularly affects commonjs exports: - VSCode Version: 1.10.2 - OS Version: Darwin 16.4.0

data.title: Prelaunch task not working with tasks v2.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0

From https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/981

I have another problem with this:
in launch.json (v 0.2.0) i have added some debugging entries with a preLaunchTask.
when i now debug, i get: There is a task {0} running. Can not run pre launch task build.
if i empty the content of the preLaunchTask, it works but the code is not built before.
Could it be that upgrading the tasks,json to v2.0.0 while having a launch,json at version 0.2.0 creates some incompatibilities?
launch.json
"version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [{
     {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (myapp)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/Services/myapp/src/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/myapp.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/Services/myapp/src/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "externalConsole": false,
            "env": {
                "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Local",
                "ASPNETCORE_URLS": "http://*:5000"
            }
     }]
tasks.json
"version": "2.0.0",
    "command": "",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [],
    "tasks": [{
            "taskName": "build",
            "command": "dotnet",
            "args": [
                "build"
            ],
            "options": {
                "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
            },
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "always",
            "problemMatcher": "$msCompile"
        },
        //... some other tasks here not related to build and a dependency between those.
]}

data.title: Multiple column breakpoints on the same line only sends first to the debugger
Add a symbol list in view bar or side bar
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Hi, I think the Minimap is a really great feature in latest version. However, I'd like a symbol list in view bar or side bar like the VS have. Because it's really convenient for me to find the function from hundreds of functions. So, could you guys think about it in the future version? Thanks!

data.title: Allow to easily search in right-clicked folder
data.body:
Hi,

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS SIerra

I would really appreciate when I could easily search the directory by
- right click the directory in Explorer
- select "Search..." action item
- it could switch to Search panel with properly predefined Directory for search...

Thanks!

data.title: Custom Theme disables other language colors
data.body:
Hi,

- VSCode Version: 1.10.**2**
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

I created a custom theme which uses `*.js` scopes to define colors for such recognized scopes. Unfortunately, the side effect is that all other file types are affected by that custom theme, it means that other file types ".json, .md, or whatever" are not colorized.

I would expect that only exact scope will be affected and other scope types will use default from Theme I selected as default during last `yo code` step when creating Custom Theme.

Or am I absolutely wrong?

I just want to rewrite `.js` file coloring to my colors. Is it simply possible, by e.g. extending some default light theme?

Thanks!

data.title: Launching or reloading task on Windows pastes clipboard text before launch command in terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy text to clipboard
2. Use F5 to launch node task

Here's an example of what shows up in the terminal tab:

![vscode-terminal-paste](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/286972/23719901/04e6f9dc-040b-11e7-89e1-b7cdca383e28.PNG)

As you can see, when it switches to the terminal tab and "pastes" in the command to execute, it also pastes in what's on the clipboard - "imported_shift" in this case.

This does not happen every time but it has happened a lot today. I'll try to note any pattern.

Launch config
```json
{
      "name": "Debug All (node2)",
      "type": "node2",
      "request": "launch",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": [
        "--nolazy",
        "${workspaceRoot}/debugall.js"
      ],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/",
      "preLaunchTask": null,
      "runtimeExecutable": null,
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development",
        "LOGSQL": "false",
        "USE_COMPRESSION": "false",
        "ENABLE_DEV_DOMAIN": "true"
      },
      "sourceMaps": false,
      "outDir": null,
      "console": "integratedTerminal",
      "skipFiles": [
        "<node_internals>/**",
        "**/node_modules/**"
      ]
    },
```

data.title: Feature Request: dynamically set "owner" for Watcher\background Tasks .
data.body:
When using a watcher task to run actions, sometimes you may only want to run an action against that single file instead of the entire project. The problem is that if you have existing matched problems, this will erase existing problem matches since they share the same "owner" property. This issue is referencing this problem #1397

For these types of tasks it would be beneficial to allow the "owner" property to be dynamically set via matcher. One way this could be achieved is via a Pattern Matcher. Using the tsc example from the [Documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_background-watching-tasks) it might look something like below.

```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "tsc",
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "watch",
            "args": ["--watch"],
            "isBackground": true,
            "problemMatcher": {
                "fileLocation": "relative",
                "pattern": {
                    "regexp": "^([^\\s].*)\\((\\d+|\\,\\d+|\\d+,\\d+,\\d+,\\d+)\\):\\s+(error|warning|info)\\s+(TS\\d+)\\s*:\\s*(.*)$",
                    "file": 1,
                    "location": 2,
                    "severity": 3,
                    "code": 4,
                    "message": 5,
                    "owner": 1
                },
                "watching": {
                    "activeOnStart": true,
                    "beginsPattern": "^\\s*\\d{1,2}:\\d{1,2}:\\d{1,2}(?: AM| PM)? - File change detected\\. Starting incremental compilation\\.\\.\\.",
                    "endsPattern": "^\\s*\\d{1,2}:\\d{1,2}:\\d{1,2}(?: AM| PM)? - Compilation complete\\. Watching for file changes\\."
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

This just sets the "owner" as the  matched File and removed the "owner" property from  "problemMatcher". This would make it where only problems matched to that file would be cleared when the watcher triggers again.


EDIT: Adding a few gifs showing an example use case.

## Pester Unit Tests - Watcher Runs all Tests

![watchproject](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/23720637/d4b794d4-0404-11e7-9091-ad26772f8555.gif)

## Pester Unit Tests - Watcher Runs only Tests for edited file

![singlererun](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/23720351/1a7bd0f8-0404-11e7-8b7d-5610740b6eeb.gif)
.

data.title: [json] support for environment variable replacements in schema URIs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi, please add support for environment variable replacements in JSON file schema properties.

Editing JSON files with vscode and the current schema support is great when using a relative path within a project or an absolute path when one is known. However, sometimes relative/absolute paths aren't possible. I believe there's already support for them in other JSON file contexts, but it doesn't look like the schema resolver is leveraging that code. (If it is, none of the syntax variations I've tried actually worked, and some of them crashed the JSON Language Server, requiring a restart.)

data.title: Keybinding changes take a few seconds to take effect
data.body:
- Open keybindings
- Add `{ "key": "ctrl+u", "command": "workbench.action.toggleSidebarPosition" }`, and save
- Remove that line, save, and press ctrl+u a few times
- The keybinding is still in effect for several seconds before it stops working. I can imagine this could be confusing if you were make quick changes to keybindings.
